bookableExtras.title: Make this a multi-day tour from Reykjavík (also book domestic flights and airport hotel transfers)

questions.label: Please specify preferred dates and timings for domestic flights (we will book the closest possible or contact you to confirm)

trips.title: Bird Watching in Grímsey
trips.description:
We offer bird watching tour from the small village of Drangsnes. The tour starts with a boat ride from Drangsnes to Grimsey Island where visitors will see the magnificent flocks of birds flying around. It is estimated that 80-90 thousand puffins live in the island as well as flocks of other species. Grimsey in Steingrimsfjordur is the biggest island of Strandir region. The legend says that Grimsey was made when three trolls were trying to dig the Westfords apart from Iceland. When tossing stones, lava and mud in all direction, Grimsey Island was formed as well as all the islands in Breidafjordur. People lived in the island until the 20th century both fishermen and farmers. 
Once in the island we walk with a guide around the island where emphasis is put on the history and bird life of the island. In good weather conditions, the boat will perhaps go around the island.

Departure is from the docks in the town, but not from the docks 2 km west from the town.
trips.excerpt: Boat ride from Drangsnes to Grimsey Island where visitors will see the magnificent flocks of birds flying around. It is estimated that 80-90 thousand puffins live in the island as well as flocks of other species.
trips.attention: Not suitable for physically disabled nor for wheelchairs as it includes a walk on uneven paths.

trips.title: Dynjandi Waterfall & The Westfjords
trips.description:
Explore Dynjandi waterfall and the stunning landscape of the Westfjords on this guided sightseeing tour from Isafjordur.

Dynjandi is one of Iceland’s most impressive & majestic waterfalls, and one of the icons of The Westfjords. It is part of a tier of 7 waterfalls, each with their own name. The top tier is called Dynjandi which means “thunderous”.

We start the tour by driving straight to the beautiful Dynjandi waterfall. There we stop for up to an hour to enjoy the wonderful views of the waterfall and Arnarfjordur fjord, and listen to the soothing sound of Dynjandi tumbling down the mountain in a series of seven waterfalls.
The top tier is certainly the most impressive but each one of the other six is unique in its own right! We highly recommend doing the optional easy hike up to the top tier.

On our way back we make some extra stops to admire some of the scenic fjords, beautiful beaches and charming villages of the Westfjords.

videos.html: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/148210533?title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0" title="Dynjandi" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

trips.included:
Small group sightseeing tour with English speaking driver guide
One hour stop at Dynjandi which is sufficient for a relaxed hike up to the top waterfall tier
trips.noPickupMsg: Attendance is at the Wild Westfjords office 5 minutes before tour departure

questions.label: Enter your Reykjavik-Isafjordur return flight details (so we can book your transfers) - note that it is ok if they are not on the same day as the tour

trips.title: RIB-Boat Whale and Island Safari
trips.excerpt: Experience Ísafjarðardjúp bay in all it’s glory. This 4 hour exciting safari tours offers you magnificent views over the landscape from the sea and visit to the island Vigur. This is an experience that's difficult to forget!
trips.included: Rib boat tour, warm overalls, life jacket, guidance and light refreshments in Vigur Island
trips.attention: Don’t forget you camera! Please note that the sailing route and duration can change due to whether conditions, each tour is unique.

trips.title: History at Hesteyri
trips.description: We offer you a guided day tour to the abounded village of Hesteyri. The village is only to be reached by boat and the boat ride from Ísafjörður takes about 70 minutes.  Luring in one of the renown Glacier Fjords (Jökulfirðir), Hesteyri has a beautiful scenery and rich history.  In the late 1940’s, the people of the village Hesteyri, made a common decision to move away, and in 1952 the village stood totally abandoned. Upon arrival at Hesteyri the guide will take you for a walk around the village, you´ll get an insight of the history and a feeling of how it was to live almost on the edge of the earth. It is also a great way to enjoy the pure, colorful nature of this area popular with hikers. The walk ends in the old Doctor´s house where you´ll be served traditional Icelandic refreshments. If lucky you´ll get a chance to see seals, arctic foxes or a whale on this tour.
trips.excerpt: A guided walk at the abounded village of Hesteyri in Hornstrandir. 1 hour boat ride from Ísafjordur to Hesteyri.

customFields.value:
Please pick up your tickets at Vesturferðir Office at Aðalstræti 7 before the tour.

Meeting point for the tour is 30 minutes before departure.

Tour operator is Sjóferðir.

trips.requirements:
Dress according to weather.

Water proofed jacket, sturdy shoes, warm hat and gloves are recommended.
trips.attention: Not suitable for physically disabled nor for wheelchairs as it includes a walk on uneven paths.

trips.title: Isafjordur Bay & The Westfjords Shore Excursion
trips.description:
We drive into the Isafjordur Bay fjord system, which lies at the heart of the Westfjords peninsula, and enjoy the great views along the way.

We stop at the Hvitanes cape seal colony where we look to spot some of our curious friends in their natural habitat. Afterwards we stop for about an hour at the traditional Icelandic turfhouse of Litlibaer, where we will be treated to delicious local waffles with tea.

Approx. schedule:
00:00 Departure from dock
01:00 Arrival at Hvitanes
01:25 Departure from Hvitanes
01:30 Arrival at Litlibaer (Refreshments served, WC facilities)
02:30 Departure from Litlibaer
03:45 Arrival at dock
We leave a 15 minute extra slack in case we need more time to complete the schedule, otherwise we might have time for a quick bonus stop

customFields.value:
Pickup at Isafjordur dock starts from 30 minutes before scheduled departure. Dropoff is back at the dock in about 4 hours.

Look for a vehicle, sign or staff member marked as Wild Westfjords. Our exact port position each day differs but we will always be located as close as possible to the harbour entry point, do not walk further than a one minute walking distance away because then you will have gone too far! And please do not walk into town, to our office, or to the information office, unless you are confident you have enough time to walk back to the dock on your own before the tour departs. We will normally not be placed at the dock until the official pickup time starts. It can be very busy during the pickup stage at the dock and we thank you in advance for your patience during this process.

The two most common port entry positions are:
- Tender: We will have a person standing by the pier who will direct you to your vehicle. If you can't find the person or vehicle please wait on the side of the Sjávarfang fish shop.
- Docking: In the vast dock platform in front of the Eimskip building. Our vehicle will be waiting for you somewhere on the platform. If you can't find us please wait by the Isafjordur Port Pickup Point sign.

In case of any last minute problems finding us, you can email us on urgent@wildwestfjords.com or call on +354-8530333. In the interest of all participants we keep our departures as punctual as possible and will normally depart at exactly the scheduled time, but may be able to wait a few minutes more when contacted by a customer that is just a few minutes away. We can not offer any refunds to customers who arrive late and miss the tour, irregardless of our best efforts and wishes not to leave anyone behind, so please make sure to be punctual.

Finally note that if your cruise ship's arrival is late, or tendering is unusually slow so that many or most of our customers are delayed, we will of course adjust our departure time accordingly.

We look forward to seeing you in beautiful Isafjordur!

trips.included:
- Sightseeing tour through beautiful fjords and viewpoints of Isafjardardjup
- English speaking driver guide for groups of 14 and less
- English speaking guide & separate driver for groups of 14-18
- Tea & waffles at Litlibaer
- Pickup and dropoff at Isafjordur dock
trips.requirements: Warm clothes suitable for Icelandic weather, preferably including waterproof jacket and pants

trips.title: Svalvogar Super Jeep
trips.description: We'll take you under the sharp cliffs of the Svalvogar peninsula. This unique and thrilling jeep trail is only open for a few months of the year and offers the essence of the Westfjords experience: intimidating mountains, panoramic fjordviews, seasonal waterfalls, diverse fauna, abandoned farms & beautiful wildlife.
trips.attention: The tour does not require any hiking ability but you must be comfortable with moderate heights and cliffhanging roads. Not suitable for people with walking difficulties and not recommended for children under 6.
trips.noPickupMsg: Attendance at the Wild Westfjords office 5 minutes before tour departure

bookableExtras.title: Svalvogar Super Jeep - extension to 9 hours (select from options in the next booking step)

questions.label: Select your extension option
questions.options:
2 hours extra, for additional time to enjoy the trail & optional walks
2 hours extra, including a 1-hour hiking stop at Dynjandi waterfall (easy but with some steps)
2 hours extra, including a 3-hour guided trek to Kaldbakur mountain peak (moderately difficult but with a fairly steep 600m ascent/descent)

trips.title: Dynjandi Waterfall & The Westfjords Shore Excursion
trips.description:
We start the tour by driving straight to Dynjandi, the majestic icon of the Westfjords. There we stop for up to an hour to enjoy the wonderful views of the waterfall and Arnarfjordur fjord, and listen to the soothing sound of Dynjandi tumbling down the mountain in a series of seven waterfalls. The top tier is certainly the most impressive but each one of the other six is unique in its own right! We highly recommend doing the easy hike up to the top tier for a magnificent view.

On our way back we stop for half an hour at Hrafnseyri, a perfect place to enjoy light refreshments and take an optional stroll around to explore the traditional turfhouses and church, or to enter the museum dedicated to Iceland's independence hero Jón Sigurðsson who was born in Hrafnseyri.

You will enjoy the fantastic landscape of the Westfjords all throughout the tour.

Approx. schedule:
00:00 Departure from dock
01:30 Arrival at Dynjandi
02:30 Departure from Dynjandi
02:45 Arrival at Hrafnseyri (Refreshments served, WC facilities)
03:30 Departure from Hrafnseyri
04:45 Arrival at dock

customFields.value:
Pickup at Isafjordur dock starts from 30 minutes before scheduled departure. Dropoff is back at the dock about 5 hours after departure.

Look for a vehicle, sign or staff member marked as Wild Westfjords. Our exact port position each day differs but we will always be located as close as possible to the harbour entry point, do not walk further than a one minute walking distance away because then you will have gone too far! And please do not walk into town, to our office, or to the information office, unless you are confident you have enough time to walk back to the dock on your own before the tour departs. We will normally not be placed at the dock until the official pickup time starts. It can be very busy during the pickup stage at the dock and we thank you in advance for your patience during this process.

The two most common port entry positions are:
- Tender: We will have a person standing by the pier who will direct you to your vehicle. If you can't find the person or vehicle please wait on the side of the Sjávarfang fish shop.
- Docking: In the vast dock platform in front of the Eimskip building. Our vehicle will be waiting for you somewhere on the platform. If you can't find us please wait by the Isafjordur Port Pickup Point sign.

In case of any last minute problems finding us, you can email us on urgent@wildwestfjords.com or call on +354-8530333. In the interest of all participants we keep our departures as punctual as possible and will normally depart at exactly the scheduled time, but may be able to wait a few minutes more when contacted by a customer that is just a few minutes away. We can not offer any refunds to customers who arrive late and miss the tour, irregardless of our best efforts and wishes not to leave anyone behind, so please make sure to be punctual.

Finally note that if a cruise ship's arrival is late, or tendering is unusually slow so that many or most of our customers are delayed, we reserve the right to delay our departure time accordingly.

We look forward to seeing you in beautiful Isafjordur!

startPoints.title: You will find us within a 1 minute walk from the port entry point

trips.included:
- Sightseeing tour through beautiful fjords to Dynjandi waterfall
- English speaking driver guide for groups of 14 and less
- English speaking guide & separate driver for groups of 15-18
- Light refreshments at Hrafnseyri (about 3 hours after departure)
- Pickup and dropoff at Isafjordur dock
trips.requirements:
- Dress according to weather and err on the warm side, as the weather can change during the tour and we'll be crossing a couple of mountain passes on the way to Dynjandi
- Water proof hiking boots or similar shoes are recommended, we will be travelling on gravel roads and the walking trails at Dynjandi can get wet even on a sunny day (due to the sprinkle from the waterfall)

trips.title: Dynjandi Waterfall & The Westfjords Shore Excursion - Deutsch

customFields.value:
Die Abholung am Ísafjörður-Dock erfolgt 30 Minuten vor der geplanten Abfahrtszeit. Die Tour endet wieder an dem Dock und es ist unser Anliegen, dort mindestens eine Stunde vor der Abfahrt des Schiffes oder letzten Tender-Bootes zu sein. Daher varieren die Tourlängen zwischen 5 und 6 Stunden.

Schauen Sie nach einem Fahrzeug, Zeichen oder Mitarbeiter ausgewiesen als Wild Westfjords. Unsere genaue Position im Hafen ist jeden Tag unterschiedlich, aber wir werden immer so nah wie möglich am Hafeneingangsbereich stehen. Gehen Sie nicht weiter als eine Minute, denn dann sind Sie bereits zu weit gegangen. Und bitte gehen Sie nur in die Stadt, zu unserem Büro oder zur Touristen-Information, wenn Sie genügend Zeit haben um wieder rechtzeitig am Dock zur geplanten Abfahrt unserer Tour anwesend zu sein. Wir sind im Normalfall noch nicht am Dock bis die offizielle Abholzeit beginnt. Es kann während der Abholphase am Dock sehr betriebsam zugehen und wir danken Ihnen bereits im Voraus für Ihre Geduld während dieses Vorgangs.

Die zwei üblichsten Hafeneingangspositionen sind:
- Tender: Es wird eine Person am Pier stehen, welche Sie zu unserem Fahrzeug weisen wird. Falls Sie diese Person (oder das Fahrzeug) nicht entdecken, dann warten Sie bitte an der Seite vom Sjávarfang Fischladen.
- Docking: Auf der weiten Dockfläche vor dem Eimskip-Gebäude. Unser Fahrzeug wird innerhalb dieser Fläche auf Sie warten. Falls Sie uns nicht entdecken können, warten Sie bitte beim dem Schild „Isafjordur Port Pickup Point“.

Im Fall von Ortungsschwierigkeiten in den letzten Minuten vor Abfahrt können Sie uns eine Email an urgent@wildwestfjords.com schreiben oder uns unter +354-8530333 anrufen. Im Interesse aller Teilnehmer halten wir unsere Abfahrten so pünktlich wie möglich und fahren normalerweise exakt zur geplanten Startzeit los, aber wir sind natürlich in der Lage noch einige Minuten zu warten, wenn wir von einem Teilnehmer konktatiert werden, der nur wenige Minuten vom Fahrzeug entfernt ist. Wir können keine Preisrückerstattung vornehmen, falls jeman zu spät kommt und die Tour dadurch verpasst. Ungeachtet unserem größten Bestreben und Wunsches niemand zurückzulassen. Daher bitten wir Sie in Sachen Pünktlichkeit auf Nummer sicher zu gehen.

Beachten Sie auch in dem Fall, dass Ihr Kreuzfahrtsschiff verspätet ankommt oder das Tendern ungewöhnlch langsam verläuft, so dass viel oder die meisten Teilnehmer verspätet sind, dass wir die Abfahrtszeit selbstverständlich entsprechend anpassen werden.

Wir freuen uns Sie bei uns im schönen Ísafjörður begrüßen zu können!
